snippet: Under a bill signed last week, New York City will study whether it is feasible to generate hydroelectric power from the city’s water supply.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on proposition that water traveling to New York City's population from Upstate New York could also be used to drive turbines and produce electricity; asserts that if theory proves viable, hydroelectric power harvested from city's water mains could be a renewable, and predictable, source of carbon-free power.
lead_paragraph: Under a bill signed last week, New York City will study whether it is feasible to generate hydroelectric power from the city’s water supply.

headline.print_headline: Seeing Source Of Electricity In Water Pipes
headline.seo: In New York’s Water Pipes, Seeing an Electricity Source
headline.main: Seeing Source of Electricity in Water Pipes
